Feb 24, 2022 | 02:55 PM EST DOUG KASS The Easy Trade May Now Be Over What a great rally, as the sound of cannons created wonderful entry prices. Now the harder work begins!
Go Blue! Now speaking at Ira's funeral, Sue Coleman President of the University Of Michigan. centralsynagogue.org/worship…
What a group of people speaking at Ira Harris' funeral now centralsynagogue.org/worship… Michigan head coach Jim Harbaugh, Penny Pritzker, my pal Ken Langone, the list goes on...

I had breakfast with Ira Harris about a week and a half ago at santambroeus.com/ - as the tears trickle down, I can't keep his smile out of my mind. He will be missed by so many. To Nikki and the kids, my thoughts are with you today...

For friends of my pal - the special Ira Harris - who have asked... here is a livestream of his 130PM funeral at Central Synagogue. centralsynagogue.org/worship… "My kind of town, Chicago is My kind of people, too, people" Ira was one kind of guy who never let me down.
Out of most of my trading long rentals from this morning. Sold $SPY $416.50 ish. @realmoney

@realmoney Feb 24, 2022 | 07:01 AM EST DOUG KASS Stated Simply I have spent months in my Diary and on FIN TV (principally Bloomberg) discussing the real economic/market/valuation challenges, the risks of "slugflation," the emerging geopolitical risks (on three continents),

the unjustified confidence of the bullish cabal and the folly of single variable market factors (e.g., unusual call activity which is often very usual). Importantly, I have emphasized the value of having outsized cash reserves in an overvalued market -- suggesting that the
notion of TINA (there is no alternative) was a bunch of B.S. By contrast, since December I have been taking TINA's cousin, that wallflower, CITA (cash is the alternative) to the dance.

Now, finally, and possibly for the first time since December 2018 and March 2020 investment opportunities with attractive reward vs. risk ratios are emerging. Let me be clear, as I have emphasized, I like this setup because it has followed a dramatic stealth bear market in

many stocks (especially of a Nasdaq-kind). I certainly may be wrong in buying today, but it is my view that, like late 2018 and early 2020, many will be fearful and could miss an attractive entry level and opportunity.

If you don't have sizeable cash reserves one can't take advantage of this morning's lower prices. And, if you approach the market emotionally, it is not likely that you will take advantage of much lower prices either. @jimcramer @tomkeene @ferrotv @lisaabramowicz1
